context_bundle.summary: YAML syntax best practices covering anchors, aliases, multi-document files, and common pitfalls to avoid

onboarding.quick_start: python -c 'import yaml; print(yaml.__version__)' && npm install js-yaml
common_patterns: Basic: 'key: value\nnested:\n  key: value' with 2-space indentation

Multiline: 'description: |
  Line 1
  Line 2' for literal, '>
  Line 1
  Line 2' for folded

Multiple documents: '---
doc1: value
---
doc2: value' separated by ---
Quotes: 'Use "double quotes" for special chars, \'single quotes\' for literals, no quotes for simple strings'
Booleans: 'true, false, yes, no, on, off (case-insensitive)'
Null: 'null, ~ or empty value for null'
known_errors: indentation error: Use consistent 2 or 4 spaces, no tabs
anchor not found: Define anchor before reference, check spelling
parsing error: Validate with yamllint, check special characters
type coercion: Quote values to preserve as strings
multi-document issues: Ensure --- separator, check parser supports multi-doc
